pages.text: Now it's time to build some bronze machines. The boiler will automatically send steam to adjacent machines, up to 8 drops per tick.$(br2)Bronze machines can only process recipes up to 2 EU/t, meaning that the recipe will use 2 Energy Units per Tick. As 1 drop of steam = 1 EU, a boiler at max temperature can power 4 machines simultaneously!
The Compressor will turn ingots into plates at 1:1 ratio. It can also turn each double ingot into 2 plates. This is probably the first machine you will want to build!
The Mixer will help you mix dusts, giving you a better ratio for bronze, fire clay and later uncooked steel. It can also create cobblestone and clay.
The Macerator will turn 2 crushed dusts into 3 dusts. Ore tripling for the win! It can also recycle all kinds of materials by turning them into dust.

The Cutting Machine will give you better ratios for bolts, gears, rings and rods. It uses a bit of lubricant every time. For now, you can only use water, but other lubricants will speed up the processing later.
The Furnace is... well... a Furnace. It is as slow as normal Furnaces, but it uses 40 times less fuel because steam is very effective.

Steam machines will accept inputs from any side, be it items, steam or another fluid.$(br2)You can lock their slots by clicking on the lock in the interface. Locked slots only accept one type of item or fluid.$(br2)Every machine has an output side, and you can enable auto-output from the interface. Hoppers, pipes and other automation can extract output items from any side, of course.

Using a wrench, you can rotate any machine by right-clicking. You can rotate the output side by sneaking while you shift-click.$(br2)Note that breaking a machine with the wrench will not drop it. Use a pickaxe for that!
